events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim seeking coverage for damages sustained.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the description of the vehicle collision incident.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's case and to provide updates regarding the collision claim process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the auto accident is under review.
Additional documents including police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates were requested to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and mechanicâ€™s damage assessment.
Investigation into the vehicle collision begun to verify the validity of the claim and assess responsibility for damages.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer was not at fault and the accident claim is eligible for settlement.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the vehicle damage assessment and repair costs outlined in the documentation.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the timely handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer after careful review.
Payment for vehicle repairs was issued to the customer's chosen repair shop to cover the approved settlement amount.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after resolution and payment processing without further outstanding issues.
All records relating to the closed auto accident claim were archived securely in accordance with company policy.
